intro: Siphoneugena micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered siphoneugena, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its delicate structure and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
